posts.post_content:
Nucleon... you don't know how right you were.  
  
http://www.wizards.com/Magic/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/ct/245  
  
Almost every single card they mention in this article is something that works much better with creatures other than Emmara — indeed, most of it works better with [Avacyn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn), which they do note in the article and then promptly ignore. While they are willing to admit Emmara was an underpowered mistake, they apparently still want us to play her when there are much better options.

Posted By: Continue (5/9/2013 10:07:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This effect could be interesting at a lower CMC. The cost of 7 is at odds with token decks that will often aggro pretty quickly, and is far too close to [Avacyn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn) to be practical. If she was weaker and cost, like, 3 or 4, you could drop her and force some pretty undesirable combats (as well as gaining protection from [Blasphemous Act](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blasphemous Act)), but as is she just comes down too late to affect anything.

posts.post_content:
... Yeah, I'm not sure what to do with her either. I guess she could work as support in EDH tokens, but that's kind of it really.  
  
You can definitely see the mistake made with her and [Voice of Resurgence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voice of Resurgence). And yet I somehow feel that if they merely swapped abilities it would all be OK. The rarity values could've even stayed the same - Voice woud've been a bit scary, but removable, and still worth Mythic due to the cheapness and this effect, and Emmara would have been a powerful recurring fatty.  
  
So strange.

posts.post_content:
So I just had to check...  
  
Being a Selesnya follower since Ravnica was introduced, and white green before that... I just had to check how Emmara rated compared to the rest of the cards in Magic.  
  
Out of 13378 cards, she is currently the 208th worst card by our community's rating standards. That's the bottom 0.5% of all magic cards.   
  
  
...What even was Wizards thinking? Limited to 10 Mythics does not give an excuse for this terrible atrocity.

I for one can't wait to see the Wizards article that talks about how secretly awesome and Jonny-tastic this card is.  
  
"Okay, guys, I know what you're thinking. But you can use her with cards that care about highest converted mana cost! Also, I like the flavor text. We too will put the ranks of the guild before you, Emmara.
